title: They were born into war. Now, they're celebrating their first birthday in the U.S.
description: Twins Lenny and Moishe were born premature to a surrogate mother in Kyiv just as Russia began its attack on Ukraine. They went through a daring journey to reach their eventual home in Chicago.

title: Democratic state attorneys general sue Biden administration over abortion pill rules
description: The suit comes as a federal judge in another case is considering whether to overturn FDA approval of the same drug, mifepristone.

title: California braces for winter storms as parts of the northern U.S. recover
description: Major winter storms continue to hit parts of the U.S. — upending travel, closing roads, and leaving thousands of households in the dark.

title: Remembering baseball announcer and former all-star catcher Tim McCarver
description: McCarver, who died Feb. 16, played in the major leagues from 1959 until 1980. After retirement, he shifted to color commentary from the broadcast booth. Originally broadcast in 1987.

title: A sci-fi magazine has cut off submissions after a flood of AI-generated stories
description: The science fiction and fantasy magazine Clarkesworld says it has been bombarded with AI-mage stories. Its publisher says it's part of a rise of side hustle culture online.

title: The Taliban ended college for women. Here's how Afghan women are defying the ban
description: The December ban on college education for women has led some to turn to online options. But that pption comes with its own set of problems.

title: North Korea says it test-fired 4 missiles a day after the U.S. held defense drills
description: The launch comes a day after the U.S. and South Korea held tabletop exercises simulating a North Korean nuclear attack.

title: What's at stake as Nigerians elect the president of Africa's largest democracy
description: The continent's largest democracy and biggest economy holds a presidential election Saturday that's come down to a race of three leading candidates.

title: Roald Dahl's publisher responds to backlash by keeping 'classic' texts in print
description: "Fat," "ugly" and "horsey face" will remain in Roald Dahl's children's books in the U.K. after all. After a fierce backlash to proposed changes, Dahl's U.K. publisher announced a "classic collection."

title: More than two million Cosori air fryers have been recalled over fire risks
description: The home appliance brand Cosori received more than 200 reports of air fryers overheating, burning or melting — several of which led to minor burn injuries and property damage.

title: WATCH: Alex Murdaugh returns to the witness stand for cross-examination
description: Friday could be a pivotal day in the murder trial of disgraced South Carolina attorney Alex Murdaugh as he faces continued questioning from prosecutors.

title: One year after Russia invaded, Ukrainians have been transformed
description: NPR remembers the beginning of Russia's war on Ukraine and the way it transformed the Ukrainian people.

title: Friendships at work can boost happiness. Here's how to nurture them
description: Sure, you may resent how much of your energy gets sucked up by your job. But research finds that keeping up relationships with colleagues may have a big upside to your health and happiness.

title: Hybrid cars are still incredibly popular, but are they good for the environment?
description: Shoppers are far more interested in hybrids than all-electric vehicles, but environmentalists believe cars like the Prius are an unnecessary detour on the path to electrification.

title: Every space crew needs a mission patch. This company has designed NASA's for 50 years
description: Since the first days of the space program, astronauts wear a special patch specific to each mission. A small North Carolina company has designed them all since the Apollo lunar launches.

title: This group gets left-leaning policies passed in red states. How? Ballot measures
description: The Fairness Project has won campaigns to raise the minimum wage and expand Medicaid in nine states dominated by Republicans. Next is abortion. But there's growing pushback from state lawmakers.

title: Why an ulcer drug could be the last option for some abortion patients
description: Some abortion providers are looking to misoprostol, a medication widely used around the world, should a federal judge in Texas block access to a key medication abortion option.

title: 'The Great Displacement' looks at communities forever altered by climate change
description: Jack Bittle's book takes a look at several communities that have been affected by climate change, and how the lives of their residents — those who have survived — have been altered by extreme weather.

title: Photographing a year of war and resilience in Ukraine
description: NPR photographer Claire Harbage shares her experiences of documenting life in Ukraine for the past year, amid the ongoing Russian invasion.

title: Alex Murdaugh denies murders, but admits to lying to police
description: The salacious murder trial of a prominent South Carolina attorney took a new twist when Alex Murdaugh (alek - mur-dock) took the stand in his own defense in the killings of his wife and son.

title: China wants peace talks between Ukraine and Russia to begin as soon as possible
description: China has called for a ceasefire in Ukraine, and for peace talks between Kyiv and Moscow.

title: Malcom X's family is suing the CIA, FBI and NYPD
description: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with Malcolm X's daughter, Ilyasah Shabazz (ih-lee-AH-sah Shah-BAHZ),  about a planned lawsuit accusing New York and federal law enforcement of concealing murder evidence.

title: One year of war in Ukraine; China wants peace; access to an abortion drug is at risk
description: Life in Russia and Ukraine has changed one year into the war. China wants the war to end as soon as possible. Plus, doctors are looking for options as an abortion medication's access is at risk.

title: Peter Obi could shake up Nigeria's election
description: As voters in Nigeria, Africa's largest democracy, go to the polls, a third party candidate threatens to upset the status quo.

title: What Ukrainians are expecting, one year after Russia invaded
description: One year to the day after Russia launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine, the country is transformed. What's ahead as the war enters its second year and how are Ukrainians thinking about the future?

title: China calls for a cease-fire and peace talks between Russia and Ukraine
description: As Russia's war in Ukraine enters its second year, Beijing has repeatedly said it would broker any cease-fire talks, a <s>proposal</s> Ukrainians are wary of because of China's close ties with Moscow.
